publications.publisher: International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics
publications.summary: The soft-constrained Schr√∂dinger bridge (SSB) is a generalization of the Schr√∂dinger bridge problem, where the terminal distribution is allowed to differ from the target distribution but is penalized by the Kullback-Leibler divergence. This approach is used to develop robust generative diffusion models and is demonstrated on the MNIST dataset.

publications.name: A quickest detection problem with false negatives
publications.summary: The problem involves detecting a drift in a Brownian motion with false negatives and costs for inspections. It is formulated as an optimal multiple stopping problem which is equivalent to a recursive optimal stopping problem. By using free boundary methods, explicit formulas for the expected cost and optimal strategy are derived.

publications.name: Rapid measurement and statistical ranking of leaf drought tolerance capacity in cotton
publications.summary: This study evaluates leaf dry matter content as an effective and faster alternative to leaf osmotic potential for measuring cotton drought tolerance. We develop a Bayesian model to rank drought tolerance, and finds a trade-off between drought tolerance and fiber yield/quality.
